result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph I Mathis

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph I Mathis in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Joseph I Mathis in custody.  James C. Griffin for Tyrone St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Joseph I Mathis not in court, in custody.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 26. Court approved transfer to felony court for global resolution.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Joseph I Mathis not in court, in custody.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47  Status conference scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Joseph I Mathis not in court, in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests a Scheduling Conference Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 47.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Any Burlington Coat Factory.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Joseph I Mathis in court.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 47  for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 7/29/15 @ 1:30 pm
